title: ISic000919. Funerary inscription for Eirene and Theodoulos
body:
1ivy-leaf τόπος ivy-leaf
2Εἰρήνης
3καὶ Θεοδού-
4λου christogram christogram ivy-leaf
5ivy-leaf ⳨

1ivy-leafΤΟΠΟΣivy-leaf
2ΕΙΡΗΝΗΣ
3ΚΑΙΘΕΟΔΟΥ
4ΛΟΥchristogramchristogramivy-leaf
5ivy-leaf⳨

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of IG;
  • 4: Both christograms are inside circles.

translation

commentary

Muscolino discusses the likely attribution of this and a number of other pieces, the earliest records of which state that it came from Taormina, but also indicate that the stones were moved to Siracusa early, leading to general attribution to Siracusa.

bibliography

  • Ferrua 1989 no. 475 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
  • Orsi 2018 Tacc. 2, p. 7 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002617
  • Rizzo 1904 115 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003144
  • Strazzulla 1897 no. 51 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001390
  • Wessel 1989 201 no.844 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Muscolino 2011-2012 232 G19 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002215
